results.title: Clarence and Angel
results.brief_description: Clarence, a black 12-year-old from a migrant family, goes to school for the first time in New York City. Although bright he cannot read and reacts furiously to taunts from other students. At school he meets Angel, a hyperactive wildly imaginative Puerto Rican boy, who misbehaves because he finishes his work so fast he gets restless while the other students work. Clarence and Angel become friends and Angel takes on the responsibility of teaching Clarence to read.

results.title: City of the sixties
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, Brisbane City Council and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Made for the Brisbane City Council showing the advances and achievements reached by capital of Queensland, Brisbane. Contains short clips of the Council’s activities such as roads and public transport, health, childcare etc as well as a celebration of cultural achievements of the city.

results.title: City of the angels
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Keith Adam and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: In the late 18th century, Rama I, first of the great Chakri kings, ordered his architects to build a new capital for Thailand - Bangkok. In Thai, Bangkok is called the “City of Angels”. Today one tenth of Thailand’s population lives in Bangkok, the most urbanised city in Thailand, which contains all the elements of Thai life seen in the extreme. Presenter Keith Adam, takes us on a tour of this city of contrast, a city of canals, superb temples and palaces alongside bustling markets, traffic jams, pollution and poverty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Barnes, Keith Adam and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: City highways
results.brief_description: An example of how heavily populated areas and shifts of population affect the lives of people. Promotes an understanding and appreciation of civic projects. Shows the planning, construction and use of controlled-access highways through metropolitan centres.

results.title: Cirque du soleil: Quidam
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Rocky Oldham, Cirque du Soleil Images and Serpent Films
results.brief_description: Cirque du Soleil’s “Quidam” is an exciting, beautifully choreographed, opulent performance. Recorded live in Amsterdam, this unique circus incorporates acrobatics, music, performance art and theatre. Sung in French with English subtitles.

results.title: Circus at the zoo
results.brief_description: Witty old chimpanzee hosts the audience through a performance by the Chimp Circus. Other chimps ride ponies, unicycles and trapeze and finish with a big band finale.

results.title: Circus
results.creator_credit: Heller Films and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of Zane, a twelve-year-old boy who samples life under the big top when he travels with the family circus in New Zealand during his school holidays. Shows Zane performing tasks in the daily circus routine as well as training and playing with the lion that he has brought up from a cub. The roles played by other members of the circus team are also noted, and a final sequence depicts a circus performance, including Zane’s first time in the ring with Nero, his lion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
